alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 4:06PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Butler and Conecuh. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall over the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have likely fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deans, Grace, Bowles, Cooks Crossroads, Commerce, Mount Olive, Mixonville, Lyeffion, Starlington, Garland, China, Bookers Mill and Fairnelson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
